COBICISTAT

  • Indications and doses
  • Pregnancy
  • Hepatic impairment
  • Renal impairment
  • Patient and carer advice
  • Prescribing and dispensing
  • Medicinal forms

Indications and doses

Pharmacokinetic enhancer used to increase the effect of atazanavir or darunavir,

By mouth

  • For adults
    150 mg once daily.

Advice when patient is pregnant

Manufacturer advises avoid unless essential.

Advice regarding hepatic impairment

Manufacturer advises avoid in severe impairment—no information available.

Advice regarding renal impairment

No dose adjustment required; inhibits tubular secretion of creatinine; when any co-administered drug requires dose adjustment based on renal function, avoid initiating cobicistat if eGFR less than 70 mL/minute/1.73 m2.

Advice for patients and carers

If a dose is more than 12 hours late, the missed dose should not be taken and the next dose should be taken at the normal time.

Information regarding prescribing and dispensing

Dispense in original container (contains desiccant).

Prepared medicinal forms of COBICISTAT

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Tablet
